creator: calestyo@scientia.net
text:
Hi.

Throughout the mod_env documentation (http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_env.html), the general part and in each directives, it's always described that "environment variables for CGI scripts and SSI pages" are set/unset/passed.

As far as I understand it however, the env-vars are not only for these two but generally the (internal) env-vars of apache (as set by SetEnvIf), which can be used by any other directive (supporting it).

This should be reflected IMHO with a sort notice, e.g.:
"sets/unsets/etc. Apache's internal environment variables which are used by some other directives and are for example passed on to CGI scripts and SSI pages".


HTH,
Chris.

this is explained in "env.html" which is already linked to both env-related modules.

I've added some hints to the two env-related modules that the internal environment variables are what's being set, but the real scoop is still in env.html
